-  description = "Shared secrets for ${local.function_name} lambda function"

file.content:
module "catalyst_document_file_upload_lambda" {
  source = "../../../../../modules/plos/lambda"

  # Required variables
  project_name               = local.project_name
  function_name              = local.function_name
  src                        = "${path.module}/src/document-file-upload"
  location                   = local.aws_region
  handler                    = "index.handler"
  lambda_security_group_name = "${local.function_name}-sg"
  cloud_watch_log_group      = "/aws/lambda/${local.function_name}"
  env_vars                   = local.environment_variables

  # Configuration
  runtime             = "nodejs22.x"
  function_timeout    = 300
  lambda_architecture = "x86_64"
  deployment_file     = "${local.app_name}.zip"
  zip_file_name       = "${local.app_name}.zip"

  # VPC Configuration
  vpc_id     = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.vpc_id
  subnet_ids = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.private_subnets

  # Security and Logging
  create_security_group        = true
  create_cloud_watch_log_group = true
}

content.text: Now I'll update the files to remove the `project_name` local variable and replace all references with `local.project_new`:

toolUseResult.originalFile:
module "catalyst_document_file_upload_lambda" {
  source = "../../../../../modules/plos/lambda"

  # Required variables
  project_name               = local.project_name
  function_name              = local.function_name
  src                        = "${path.module}/src/document-file-upload"
  location                   = local.aws_region
  handler                    = "index.handler"
  lambda_security_group_name = "${local.function_name}-sg"
  cloud_watch_log_group      = "/aws/lambda/${local.function_name}"
  env_vars                   = local.environment_variables

  # Configuration
  runtime             = "nodejs22.x"
  function_timeout    = 300
  lambda_architecture = "x86_64"
  deployment_file     = "${local.app_name}.zip"
  zip_file_name       = "${local.app_name}.zip"

  # VPC Configuration
  vpc_id     = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.vpc_id
  subnet_ids = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.private_subnets

  # Security and Logging
  create_security_group        = true
  create_cloud_watch_log_group = true
}

message.content:
Create a readme for this terraform project. Mention clearly and visibly that the project code that's deployed in this lambda is in another git repo: https://github.com/omfplos/document-integrations/settings/branches
@/Users/a.agrawal/work/omfsvcshub/infrastructure/terraform/aws/omfsvcshubdev/us-east-1/plos/develop/catalyst-document-file-upload/locals.tf:6

input.content:
# Catalyst Document File Upload Lambda

## ⚠️ Important: Source Code Location

**The actual Lambda function code is NOT in this repository.**

The Lambda function source code is maintained in a separate repository:
**[https://github.com/omfplos/document-integrations](https://github.com/omfplos/document-integrations)**

This Terraform configuration only handles the AWS infrastructure deployment for the Lambda function.

## Overview

This Terraform module deploys the `catalyst-document-file-upload` Lambda function in the AWS environment. The function is part of the Catalyst project and handles document file upload operations.

## Configuration

### Function Details
- **Function Name**: `catalyst-document-file-upload-develop`
- **Runtime**: Node.js 22.x
- **Timeout**: 300 seconds
- **Architecture**: x86_64

### Secrets Management

Secrets are managed through AWS Secrets Manager and are configured in the `plos-secrets` Terraform project within this environment's directory.

The Lambda function uses the following shared secret:
- `develop/catalyst/document-file-upload-lambda-shared`

### Environment Variables

Environment variables are automatically populated from the shared secrets configuration and include:
- `DOMAIN_GATEWAY_URL`
- `KAFKA_TOPIC_NAME`

## Deployment

This configuration is deployed as part of the PLOS infrastructure in the `develop` environment.

### Prerequisites
- AWS credentials configured
- Terraform initialized
- Access to the shared VPC and security groups

### Files Structure
- `main.tf` - Lambda function module configuration
- `locals.tf` - Local variables and secrets configuration
- `data.tf` - Data sources for shared infrastructure
- `README.md` - This documentation

## Development Workflow

1. **Lambda Code Changes**: Make changes in the [document-integrations repository](https://github.com/omfplos/document-integrations)
2. **Infrastructure Changes**: Make changes in this Terraform configuration
3. **Deployment**: Apply Terraform changes to update the Lambda infrastructure

## Related Resources

- Source Code Repository: [omfplos/document-integrations](https://github.com/omfplos/document-integrations)
- Lambda Module: `../../../../../modules/plos/lambda`
- Secrets Configuration: `../plos-secrets/`

input.content:
# Catalyst Document File Upload Lambda

## ⚠️ Important: Source Code Location

**The actual Lambda function code is NOT in this repository.**

The Lambda function source code is maintained in a separate repository:
**[https://github.com/omfplos/document-integrations](https://github.com/omfplos/document-integrations)**

This Terraform configuration only handles the AWS infrastructure deployment for the Lambda function.

## Overview

This Terraform module deploys the `catalyst-document-file-upload` Lambda function in the AWS environment. The function is part of the Catalyst project and handles document file upload operations.

## Configuration

### Function Details
- **Function Name**: `catalyst-document-file-upload-develop`
- **Runtime**: Node.js 22.x
- **Timeout**: 300 seconds
- **Architecture**: x86_64

### Secrets Management

Secrets are managed through AWS Secrets Manager and are configured in the `plos-secrets` Terraform project within this environment's directory.

The Lambda function uses the following shared secret:
- `develop/catalyst/document-file-upload-lambda-shared`

### Environment Variables

Environment variables are automatically populated from the shared secrets configuration and include:
- `DOMAIN_GATEWAY_URL`
- `KAFKA_TOPIC_NAME`

## Deployment

This infrastructure is deployed using **Atlantis** with a PR-based workflow.

### Deployment Process
1. Create a pull request with your Terraform changes
2. Atlantis will automatically plan the changes and comment on the PR
3. Review the plan output in the PR comments
4. Apply changes by commenting `atlantis apply` on the PR
5. Merge the PR after successful deployment

### Prerequisites
- AWS credentials configured in Atlantis
- Pull request approval workflow
- Access to the shared VPC and security groups

### Files Structure
- `main.tf` - Lambda function module configuration
- `locals.tf` - Local variables and secrets configuration
- `data.tf` - Data sources for shared infrastructure
- `README.md` - This documentation

## Development Workflow

1. **Lambda Code Changes**: Make changes in the [document-integrations repository](https://github.com/omfplos/document-integrations)
2. **Infrastructure Changes**: Make changes in this Terraform configuration via pull request
3. **Atlantis Deployment**: Use PR workflow with Atlantis to apply infrastructure changes

## Related Resources

- Source Code Repository: [omfplos/document-integrations](https://github.com/omfplos/document-integrations)
- Lambda Module: `../../../../../modules/plos/lambda`
- Secrets Configuration: `../plos-secrets/`
